Homicide by Use of Vehicle w/ PAC (2nd+)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J. Steinhorst was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Intox Use of Vehicle (2nd+), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment/programming per agent.  Not to possess any alcohol or other mood altering substances w/o a valid prescription. Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.

If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew J. Steinhorst in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby.  Defendant Matthew J. Steinhorst in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht and Kevin Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court and parties have recv'd PSI.  Atty. Ruby clarifies some convictions of PSI writer put in that are not. T.W. and N.W. to makes statements for victim.  R.A. and K.A. to make statements on behalf of defendant.  Court will have State's statements first.  N.W. speaks.  T.W. speaks.  R.A. speaks on behalf of defendant.  K.A. speaks on behalf of defendant.  Court reviews written VIS.  Atty. Albrecht makes statement.  11 yrs. IC/6 yrs. ES.  Atty. Ruby makes statement, states factors of defendant.  DE makes statement.  Break.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 1:

WI State Prison for 18 years (11 years Initial Confinement/7 years Extended Supervision)  
655 days credit not including today
Submit to DNA Sample
Undergo any counseling and treatment programming per agent
No entry into any establishment that sells alcohol
No possession of alcohol or other mood altering substances w/o valid prescription
AODA & treatment
5 years revocation of DL
IID for 1 year upon licensure
$518.00 Costs & Supervision Fees
Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Not Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Paperwork handed in court
Sentencing hearing on December 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on December 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on October 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew J. Steinhorst in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby.  Kevin R. Calkins and Mike Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   DAY 5 - 8:35 Court states case.  Atty. Calkins states appearances.  Court states to the parties on jury instructions.  8:38 Jury in.  Court instructs the jury.  Atty. Albrecht starts closing 9:00 am.  Recess 10:05.On record 10:24.  Jury in.  Atty. Ruby starts closings 10:25.  Atty. Albrecht does rebuttal closing 11:28.  Clerk drew alternates.  Court instructs jury for deliberating.  Clerk sworn in bailiff 11:50.  On record Question #1 - 1:09. On record 3:01.  Jury in 3:02 pm with verdict.  Court reads the verdicts.  Guilty Ct. 1.  Guilty Ct. 2.  Guilty Ct. 3.  Court polls the jury.  Jury excused.  Court accepts the verdict.  State moves judgment on verdict.  Court orders PSI.  DE will held with no bail pending sentencing.

Defendant Matthew J. Steinhorst in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby.  Kevin R. Calkins and Mike Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    DAY 4 - Court calls case 8:35 and Atty. Calkins states appearances.  Jury in 8:38.  Atty. Calkins calls Sgt. James Hodges, SCSD, S&T.  Recess 10:10. On the record 10:26.  Jury in 10:28.  Atty. Calkins continue direct.  Atty. Ruby cross exam 11:23. Recess 12:05.  On record 1:07.  Jury in 1:08.  Atty. Ruby continues cross. Atty. Calkins redirect.  Atty. Ruby recross. Witness excused.  State rests 1:35.  Jury out 1:35.  Parties address some matters.  DE not to testify.  Court does collaque of defendant.  DE concurs.  Atty. Ruby satisfied with decision.  Court finds DE fully advised of rights.  2 witnesses for defense have prior convictions. Court allows reference to BS but not to NM.  On the record 1:50.  Jury in 1:51.  Atty. Ruby calls B.S., S&T.  State objects.  Court sustains.  Atty. Calkins cross exam.  Witness excused.  Atty. Ruby calls N.M., S&T. Atty. Calkins cross exam. Atty. Ruby redirect.  Witness excused.  Atty. Ruby calls Z.P., S&T.  Atty. Calkins cross exam.  Witness excused.  Atty. Ruby calls R.A., S&T.  Atty. Calkins objects.  Court overrules.  Atty. Calkins objects to #170, relevance.  Court excuses jury 2:50.  Atty. Ruby makes argument. Atty. Calkins argues.  Court states under 904.01 - find relevant.  Parties discuss to keep jury late or come back tomorrow.  Jury in 3:01. Atty. Ruby continues direct.  Atty. Calkins cross exam. Witness excused.  Defense rests 3:08. Recess.   On record 3:32.  State has two rebuttal witness'. Court will allow.  Jury in 3:36. Atty. Calkins calls B.D., S&T.  Atty. Ruby cross exam.  Atty. Calkins calls D.R., S&T. Atty. Ruby cross exam.  Jury excused. On record 3:58. Jury in 3:59.  Testimony closed. Court instructs jury for conclusions of today.  Reconvene with jury at 8:30.  Parties go thru jury instructions.  115, 1189, 1187, 140, 145, 103, 162, 170, 173, 155, 148, 147, 150, 190, 189, 200, 205, 325, 160, 460, 484, 525. Recess 4:25.

Defendant Matthew J. Steinhorst in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby.  Kevin R. Calkins and Mike Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    DAY 3 - 9:10 Court states case.  Parties state appearances.  Jury in 9:12.  Atty. Calkins calls Dr. Michael Foley, emergency physician, S&T.  Offered & recv'd #131.  Atty. Ruby cross exam.  Witness released from subpoena.  Atty. Albrecht calls detective Scott Steinhorst, S&T. Offered exh. 143-146.  Atty. Ruby cross exam. Atty. Albrecht redirect. Witness excused from subpoena. Recess 10:30. Jury in 10:48.  State reads stipulations.  Atty. Albrecht calls detective Justin Hannagan, S&T.  Offered and recv'd exh. #63 - 84.  Atty. Ruby cross exam.  Atty. Albrecht redirect.  11:50 Atty. Albrecht calls crime lab analyst William Newhouse, S&T. Recess 12:05.  On record 1:07.  Jury in 1:08.  Atty. Albrecht continue with direct.  Recess 2:48.  On record 3:08.  Jury in 3:09.  Atty. Ruby cross exam.  Atty. Ruby redirect.  Witness excused and released.  Atty. Albrecht calls crime lab analyst Rebecca Ciske, S&T.  Witness ID's #151, #163, #130, #108.  State shows witness other exhibits for their ID.  State moves 127-130, 147,149, 152, 153,154, 155, 157, 156, 143, 158.  Court receives those exhibits.  Parties discuss exhibits.  Court receives exhibits 143 - 159.  Atty Ruby does cross-exam.  Witness excused.  Court excuses witness from both subpeonas.  State requests they reconvene tomorrow morning with their last witness.  Court will start at 8:30 tomorrow morning.  Court admonishes jury re: disucssing this matter and jury is excused at 5:03 pm.  Court asks parties to review preliminary instructions tonight to prepare for instructions when they get there.  State has one more witness and then the defense can begin their case.  Recess at 5:05 pm.

Defendant Matthew J. Steinhorst in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby.  Kevin R. Calkins and Mike Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DAY 2 TRIAL -   9:02 Court calls the case & parties state appearances.  Jury in 9:04.  Parties approach the bench.  9:08 Atty. Calkins calls srgt. Eric VandenHuevel, SCSD, S&T.  Recv'd exh. 57 & #6.  Witness ID'd defendant.  Recv'd exh. 7. Offered exh. 9-56, recv'd.  Witness ID's all photos. Recess 10:32. Back on record 10:50.  Atty. Calkins addresses the sidebar the parties had.  Court states that kind of contact wouldn't effect the jury.  Atty. Calkins also address one of the witness' is following this on the baraboo scanner.  Court will address the witness when that witness is here.  Jury in 10:55.  Atty. Calkins continues direct of witness.  Atty. Ruby cross exam witness.  Atty. Calkins redirect.  Atty. Ruby recross.  Witness released.  11:36 Atty. Albrecht calls deputy Patrick Wex, SCSD, S&T. Offered & recv'd exh. 58-60.  Recess 12:00. Jury in 1:06.  Atty. Albrecht continue direct.  Atty. Ruby cross exam.  Offered & recv'd exh. #142.  Atty. Albrecht redirect.  Atty. Ruby objects asked & answered.  Court will allow but rephrase. Witness released.  Atty. Calkins calls A.T., S&T.  Offered & recv'd #62 .  Atty. Ruby cross exam. Atty. Calkins redirect. Witness released. Atty. Calkins calls Robert Corliss, forensic pathologist, S&T. Offered & recv'd #132-133. Parties side bar.  Recess 2:36, jury out.  Atty. Calkins address the Court on the questioning next.  Atty. Ruby objects to questioning, speculative, too many variables.  Court will allow some questioning but limited.  Atty. Ruby address AT's testimony, not discovery.  Court grants motion to testimony. On record 3:00.  Atty. Calkins brings up sequest of witness' and testimony of next witness'.  Only found newspaper article that was out.  May want to voir dire those witness'.  Atty. Calkins talked to witness'.  Jury in 3:20.  Atty. Calkins continue direct.  Atty. Ruby cross exam.  Atty. Calkins redirect.  Witness released from subpoena. Atty. Calkins calls D.M., S&T.  Recv'd #61.  Atty. Ruby cross exam.  Witness excused.  Atty. Calkins calls M.B., S&T.  Atty. Ruby cross exam.  Witness released from subpoena.  Atty. Albrecht calls A.K, Baraboo paramedic, S&T.  Jury excused 4:11.  Atty. Ruby objects discovery violation, expert opinion.  Court sustains.  Jury in 4:18.  Atty. Ruby cross exam.  Atty. Albrecht redirects.  Witness released from subpoena.  Atty. Albrecht calls R.H., paramedic, S&T.  Atty. Ruby cross exam. Witness released from subpoena.  Jury out 4:37.  Reconvene at 9:00.
Cover Letter from Atty. Ruby on voir dire questions
Cover Letter from Atty. Calkins on witness'

Defendant Matthew J. Steinhorst in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby.  Kevin R. Calkins  and Mike Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DAY 1 - JURY TRIAL.     Court does introduction 9:09.  Clerk calls potential jurors.  Court does voir dire.  Atty Albrecht does voir dire 9:40. Excused #2808, #1222, #3822, #3455, #365, #121, #1726.  Called forwarded #1820, #842, #4370, #2545, #1834.  Atty. Ruby does voir dire 10:25.  Recess 11:05.  On the record 11:33.  Jury picked 12:05.  Court instructs jury.  Recess 12:12.  On the record 1:20. Court making record w/atty's on sequestion of witness' after opening statements.  Stipulation on driving record.  Exhibit 140 De's certified driving record.  Offered and Recv'd.  Offer of Proof standard elements.  #1189 instruction, strick first line.  #1187 instruction, include Delta 9 THC.  State objects to deleting end of jury instruction of finding guilt, search for truth not doubt.  Court denies motion at this time. Atty. Ruby makes statement on jury instruction committee and it's not the law.  Jury in 1:43.  Atty. Calkins does opening 1:55.  Atty. Ruby objects.  Jury out.  Atty. Ruby makes argument on discovery violations, not in any police reports.  Atty. Calkins cannot find at this time.  Court sustains objection and should be striken.  Atty. Ruby discusses with client.  Atty. Ruby recommends what to say to jury.  Jury in 2:23.  Court addresses the jury statement is striken and jury not to consider.  Recess 3 pm.  Back on record 3:16.  Atty. Ruby makes opening statement.  Atty. Calkins reads stipulation and plays 911 DVD (marked as exh. 1) 4:02.  Exhibit 1 recv'd.  Atty. Calkins calls K.S., sworn in & testifies.  Atty. Ruby cross exam.  Atty. Calkins redirect.  Release witness from subpoena.  4:38 Atty. Calkins calls B.S., sworn in & testifies.  Atty. Ruby cross exam.  Marked exh. 141.  Recv'd.  Published to jury.  Atty. Calkins redirect.  Witness released from subpoena.  Jury out 5 pm.  Reconvene at 9:00 am.
DE's brief in support of the requested jury instrcution on the burden of proof

Defendant Matthew J. Steinhorst in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby.  Defendant Matthew J. Steinhorst in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  Court makes ruling re: motion hearing held on 8/23/2016.  Court denies DE motions in limine.  Notes matter is set for trial on 9/12.  Atty Ruby asks for clarification re: affidavit he supplied indicating what DE would testify to re: the victim driving the DE's vehicle on different occasions.  State responds.  Court agrees that statement would be admissible.  State notes there are stipulations being circulated that would reduce the number of witnesses to be called at JT.  Court requests the parties submit proposed jury instructions by number to the Court by 9/7/2016.  Any questions they would like the Court to ask the jury during voir dire by Friday September 9.  If there are going to be any stipulations re: witnesses that would be helpful as well.  Parties are not aware of any issues at this time that still have to be addressed.  Court notes extra jurors are being called in/parties discuss alternate jurors.  Atty Ruby provides proposed order to the Court for her signature.  State doesn't object.  Court signs proposed order.
Defendant's brief in support of motion to admit character & habit evidence
granting State's motion to admit statements & allow impeachment & motions in limine 1-6
Oral ruling on September 2, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew J. Steinhorst in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby.  Defendant Matthew J. Steinhorst in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins and Michael Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  State notes we are here for a motion hearing on several motions that have been filed.  State requests evidentiary portion of motions be heard first.  Atty Ruby is in agreement w/how to proceed w/evidentiary motion first.  ATty Ruby notes filing of the 911 statement are not objected to, nor are the statements made to Dep. VandenHuevel.  All other statements are being objected to.  State notes stipulation agreed to re: 911 tape and will be filed at trial.  State intends to submit some evidence re: Dep. VandenHeuvel.  Atty Albrecht calls Eric VandenHeuvel - SCSD - S&T.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  State continues direct.  Atty Ruby does cross-exam.  Witness excused.  Atty Albrecht calls Dep. Patrick Wex - SCSD - S&T.  Parties stip to ID of DE.  State continues direct.  Atty Ruby interrupts to asks for seclusion of Det. Steinhorst as he's in the courtroom.  Court so orders and Det. Steinhorst leaves the courtroom.  State continues direct.  Atty Ruby does cross-exam.  State has exhibit #1 marked and ID'd.  Court receives exhibit #1.  Witness excused.  State requests Dep. Wex and Dep. VandenHuevel be released from their subpeonas.  Court so orders.  Atty Albrecht calls Det. Scott Steinhorst - SCSD - S&T.  Atty Ruby does cross-exam.  Witness excused and Det. Steinhorst is released from his subpeona.  Parties have no further witnesses to call.  State makes brief argument.  Atty Ruby requests brief recess.  Court will recess for 10 minutes.  Back on the record at 10:16 a.m.  Atty Ruby requests the Court reopen the evidentiary evidence portion briefly.  Court will allow it.  Atty Ruby calls the DE - S&T.  Witness reviews exhibit #1.  Atty Albrecht does cross-exam.  Witness excused.  State will make no argument.  Atty Ruby makes argument that statements made should not be allowed.  Court finds DE was not in custody and the statements made will be allowed and the Court grants the State's motion.  State notes they have no further evidentiary testimony.  Atty Ruby says he doesn't either and notes he filed an index and would proceed w/those based on those documents.  Atty Ruby notes he reviewed 6 motions in limine filed by the State and he doesn't object to motions 1, 2, 5 and 6.  Atty Ruby addresses #3, agrees generally speaking, and then with #4 he doesn't have any other witnesses at this time but notes the investigation is on going.  Agrees to file motion to seek to admit should one come up.  Court grants the State's motions and requests the State to prepare an order to reflect that and the statements being admitted.  State addresses motion filed the same days re: prior criminal convictions which they feel would be 10.  Atty Ruby argues against counting the OAR convictions and two others.  State responds.  Court will allow use of all 10 convictions should the DE testify.  Court notes motion re: discovery sanctions has been addressed.  State withdraws that motion at this time as they have received discovery as requested.  Court will not address concerns re: lateness of discovery as the State is now withdrawing their motion.  State has reviewed request by DE and they are ready to address those matters.  Atty Calkins addresses first motion re: sequestration to be obeyed only during testimony, otherwise no objection.  Atty Ruby responds, wants sequestration during opening statements too.  Parties respond.  Atty Ruby withdraws objection.  Court grants sequestration during trial/testimony only.  Will not apply during voir dire or opening statements.  State doesn't object to motions 2-5.  State requests Court hold #6 at bay at this time.  Atty Ruby agrees.  Parties agree the same on #7.  Court will hold open 6 and 7.  #8 has already been held.  #9 would be addressed outside of the jury if a person is to testify.  #10 addresses prelim hearing testimony and that would be a heresay evidence rule.  #11 - State marks exhibit #2 in response.  Atty Ruby interrupts and states he isn't objecting to the statement the State is trying to argue.  Court holds open making decision at this point.  State doesn't object to #12.  #13 is a general request and may need to be addressed.  Atty Ruby notes his motion may be too broad.  Court holds open ruling pending it coming up at trial.  State responds to #14.  Court notes no objection to 14.  State responds to #15 - stipulation to be submitted as to the 911 call.  Atty Ruby is in agreement.  Final stipulations could be filed by the end of next week.  Court notes DE motion to admit evidence of character & habit.  State notes none of the evidence in the appendix should be submitted.  Atty Ruby cites probitive information re: speeding possibly being a factor.  State responds.  Atty Ruby requests clarification.  State requests from the Court how she would like him to proceed.  Atty Ruby responds.  State makes statement made in Dep. Wex's report re: seatbelt.  Atty Ruby responds.  Court questions State re: "character" of the victim concern.  State responds.  Court questions Atty Ruby re: "character" evidence.  Atty Ruby responds.  Court notes her intention is to allow parties to submit further written argument.  They will have one week to submit that or until 8/30/2016.  Court would then set this for continued hearing shortly after that week is up.  State notes he will be availabe on 9/2 as is Atty Ruby but he'd prefer to make oral arguments today re: the motions filed rather than do them in writing.  State continues argument.  Atty Ruby states anything else he wishes to add he can do in writing.  Court advises State again to prepare an order for the Court's signature on their motions granted today.  Advises Atty Ruby to do the same.  Written responses due from both parties by 8/30/2016.  Court sets bench ruling for 9/2/2016.  Oral ruling scheduled for September 2, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew J. Steinhorst in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby.  Defendant Matthew J. Steinhorst in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial Br. 3.  Bond continues.

Defendant Matthew J. Steinhorst in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby.  Defendant Matthew J. Steinhorst in custody.  Kevin Calkins and Michael Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states case and appearances.  Atty Albrecht calls Det. Justin Hannagan - SCSD - S&T.  Court to reflect ID of DE.  Atty Albrecht continues direct exam of Det. Hannagan.  Atty Ruby does cross-exam.  No re-direct from State.  Atty Ruby has no witnesses.  Testimony is closed.  Court finds probable cause and binds over.  Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew J. Steinhorst in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby.  Defendant Matthew J. Steinhorst in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Pre-trial conference on March 20, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Return date on March 31, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew J. Steinhorst appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Cole Ruby. Prosecuting Atty Kevin R. Calkins appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State requests significant cash bond and gives history. Atty. Ruby explains history & is not a flight risk.   Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $100,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Not operate m/v w/o valid DL; Submit to chemical testing if requested; Absolute Sobriety  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 10:45 am.  Return date scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
